tables.description: Tesla 10‑Q (Q3 2025) reports total revenues of **$28.1 B** for the three months ended Sept 30 2025 (up from $25.2 B YoY), with **automotive sales $20.4 B**, automotive regulatory credits $0.4 B, automotive leasing $0.43 B, energy generation & storage $3.4 B and services & other $3.5 B; cost of revenues $23.0 B yields **gross profit $5.05 B**. Operating expenses were $3.43 B (R&D $1.63 B, SG&A $1.56 B, restructuring $0.24 B), resulting in **income from operations $1.62 B**, interest income $0.44 B, provision for income taxes $0.57 B and **net income $1.39 B** ($0.43 basic EPS, $0.39 diluted EPS; diluted shares 3.53 M). For the nine‑month period, total revenues were **$69.9 B** (vs $71.9 B prior year), net income $2.999 B with **basic EPS $0.92**, diluted EPS $0.84, and automotive revenues $51.8 B.

tables.description: Tesla’s Q3 2025 10‑Q balance sheet reports total equity of **$80.7 B** as of September 30 2025 (up from $78.0 B on June 30), comprising **common stock $3.3 B**, **additional paid‑in capital $41.6 B**, **retained earnings $38.2 B**, and **noncontrolling interests $0.7 B**. Shares outstanding declined to **59 M** (from 61 M) and the quarter generated **net income $1.39 B** with **other comprehensive income $49 M**. The period also reflects **issuance of 100 M shares for equity‑incentive awards**, **stock‑based compensation $512 M**, and a **$25 M distribution to noncontrolling interests**.
